topic: Generative Foundation Model Guidelines

  entities:
    Generative Foundation Model|Model
    European Union's AI Act|Organization
    AI Bill of Rights|Project
    Guideline 1|Feature
    Guideline 2|Feature

  proposition: Considerations for Establishing Trustworthy Generative Foundation Model Guidelines
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Model|DESCRIBED_BY|trustworthy
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Ethical considerations are essential to ensure models respect human rights, cultural diversity, and societal values.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Model|REQUIRES|ethical considerations
    Generative Foundation Model|RESPECTS|human rights
    Generative Foundation Model|RESPECTS|cultural diversity
    Generative Foundation Model|RESPECTS|societal values
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Ethical considerations emphasize fairness, preventing bias, and promoting inclusivity when interacting with users from diverse backgrounds.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Model|EMPHASIZES|fairness
    Generative Foundation Model|PREVENTS|bias
    Generative Foundation Model|PROMOTES|inclusivity
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Social responsibility demands models avoid harm and contribute positively to society by generating ethical outcomes.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Model|REQUIRES|social responsibility
    Generative Foundation Model|AVOIDS|harm
    Generative Foundation Model|GENERATES|ethical outcomes
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Model design should integrate ethical risk assessments and include mechanisms to prevent harmful or discriminatory outputs.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Model|REQUIRES|ethical risk assessments
    Generative Foundation Model|PREVENTS|harmful outputs
    Generative Foundation Model|PREVENTS|discriminatory outputs
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Risk management guidelines must account for managing and mitigating threats from adversarial attacks and internal model failures.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Model|REQUIRES|risk management guidelines
    Generative Foundation Model|MITIGATES|adversarial attacks
    Generative Foundation Model|MITIGATES|internal model failures
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Models should be designed to be robust against adversarial attacks, unexpected inputs, and potential misuse.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Model|DESIGNED_AS|robust
    Generative Foundation Model|RESISTS|adversarial attacks
    Generative Foundation Model|RESISTS|unexpected inputs
    Generative Foundation Model|RESISTS|potential misuse
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: A multidisciplinary team of researchers from various fields synthesized existing principles, policies, and regulations to create the guidelines.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Model|CREATED_BY|multidisciplinary team
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: The team reviewed documents from corporate sources, European Union's AI Act, and the Blueprint for an AI Bill of Rights.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    None
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Multidisciplinary Team|REVIEWED|European Union's AI Act
    Multidisciplinary Team|REVIEWED|AI Bill of Rights

  proposition: Guideline 1 focuses on designing generative models to ensure fairness, uphold values, and minimize biases in user interactions.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guideline 1|FOCUSES_ON|fairness
    Guideline 1|FOCUSES_ON|upholding values
    Guideline 1|FOCUSES_ON|minimizing biases
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Guideline 1|APPLIES_TO|Generative Foundation Model

  proposition: Governments mandate the use of representative data to prevent unjustified differential treatment.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Model|REQUIRES|representative data
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Guideline 2 requires clear communication of the model's intended use and limitations to users.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guideline 2|REQUIRES|clear communication
    Generative Foundation Model|COMMUNICATES|intended use
    Generative Foundation Model|COMMUNICATES|limitations
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Guideline 2|APPLIES_TO|Generative Foundation Model
